html: 1.18.18  7:32 pm   Am I eventually going to have to climb that mountain of learning the whole production-side of making music? When I record I just play into a shit mic that plugs into my computer and I have this interface thing (don't even know what you'd call that type of device) where I can record guitar or keys straight into the computer. I just use the standard recording program that just came with my computer (audacity).. i dont do anything with effects any editing apart from just adjusting the volumes of each track. I love writing and recording music, but the sound quality is always crap. Doesn't really bother me now. But again, I feel like at some point I'm going to have to climb that mountain of learning that side of making music. And it scares me because I don't know where and how to start or when I should just bite the bullet and dive head first into this world.

1.18.18  3:15 pm   bill at around 11 seconds into the new video after the line "or to be like you" you do a little drum fill with your mouth half open and looking sort of suprised. im wondering was this influenced by other drummers because they sort of do the same thing.

      for example in the hello goodbye music video at 1.16 https://youtu.be/rblYSKz_VnI?t=1m16s  ringo starr does the same thing, suprised with a slightly opened mouth while doing a drum fill. were you inspired, or was this coincidental?
